newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: VILNIAUS BANK SAYS Q1 NET PROFIT UP.
newsitem.headline: VILNIAUS BANK SAYS Q1 NET PROFIT UP.

text.p: Lithuania's leading private bank, Vilniaus Bank, said on Friday that its Q1 audited net profit was 10.49 million litas versus 5.04 million litas for the same period last year.

Julius Niedvaras, the chairman of the bank, also told a news conference that according to Lithuanian accounting standards, the bank's net profit for the first three months of the year was around 15 million litas.
He added that the bank's assets grew in the first quarter of 1997 to 946.93 million litas from 914.65 million litas.
"The bank was planning a net profit for 1997 of around 40 million litas...we think that the figure could be higher," Niedvaras said.
He added that the bank was eyeing the possibility of expanding its banking and leasing operations into neighbouring and CIS countries.
"We have started to examine possibilities in neighbouring countries and are also looking further," he said.
"Our researchers are currently gathering information in the Baltic counrties, Ukraine, Russia, Kazakhstan, Belarus, Uzbekistan and Poland," he said, adding that the bank was planning no hasty moves.
Niedvaras also confirmed that Vilniaus Bank was considering buying a stake in the State Commercial Bank, which has been slated for privatisation.
"We have submitted a letter of intent to the government expressing our interest in participating in the privatisation of the State Commercial Bank," he said.
He added that the bank was examining the financial results of four to five other Lithuanian banks with the intention of acquiring a stake in at least one of them.
